definition: Since they have come, we should make them comfortable (idiom). Since we're here, take it easy./Since this is so, we should accept it./Now we have come, let's stay and take the rough with the smooth./If you can't do anything to prevent it, you might as well sit back and enjoy it.
pinyin: ji4 lai2 zhi1 , ze2 an1 zhi1

definition: already/since/both... (and...)
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
surname An
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
counter soldiers with arms, water with an earth weir (idiom); different situations call for different action/to adopt measures appropriate to the actual situation
pinyin: bing1 lai2 jiang4 dang3 , shui3 lai2 tu3 yan3

definition: lit. when the boat gets to the pier-head, it will go straight with the current (proverb)/fig. everything will be all right/cf 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: chuan2 dao4 qiao2 tou2 zi4 ran2 zhi2

definition: lit. When we get to the mountain, there'll be a way through. (idiom)/fig. Everything will turn out for the best./Let's worry about it when it happens./It will be all right on the night./cf couplet 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: che1 dao4 shan1 qian2 bi4 you3 lu4

definition: to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
planning is with man, accomplishing with heaven (idiom); Man proposes but God disposes.
pinyin: mou2 shi4 zai4 ren2 , cheng2 shi4 zai4 tian1

definition: How do you catch the tiger cub without entering the tiger's lair? (idiom); Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
pinyin: bu4 ru4 hu3 xue2 , yan1 de2 hu3 zi3

definition: life and death are ruled by fate (idiom)
the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
neither for nor against sth/indifferent
to try one's utmost/to strive
it is better to avoid unnecessary trouble (idiom)/the less complications the better
pinyin: duo1 yi1 shi4 bu4 ru2 shao3 yi1 shi4

definition: the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: lit. to give medicine to a dead horse (idiom)/fig. to keep trying everything in a desperate situation
pinyin: si3 ma3 dang4 huo2 ma3 yi1

definition: to handle the situation calmly (idiom)/unruffled/to treat the situation lightly

lit. When we get to the mountain, there'll be a way through. (idiom)/fig. Everything will turn out for the best./Let's worry about it when it happens./It will be all right on the night./cf couplet 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: che1 dao4 shan1 qian2 zi4 you3 lu4

definition: lit. to be the meat on sb's chopping block (idiom)/fig. to be at sb's mercy
pinyin: ren2 wei2 dao1 zu3 , wo3 wei2 yu2 rou4
